info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 06 at 6:55PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Forest Service Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Sandpoint ID ...The Forest Service Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Sandpoint ID has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch... * WHAT...The avalanche danger is expected to rise to HIGH. * WHERE...For the St. Regis/Silver Valley area, Selkirk Mountains, Purcell Range, East and West Cabinets * WHEN...In effect until 8 PM MST Friday * IMPACTS...Heavy snow and warming temperatures combined with wind will likely create widespread areas of unstable snow on Friday.
info.instruction: A potent weather system is predicted to impact the area bringing heavy snowfall, strong winds and rising temperatures. These conditions will likely cause a rapid rise in avalanche hazard by Friday morning. Steep slopes and avalanche terrain should be avoided. Avalanche advisory will be posted at 7:00 A.M. Friday morning. Consult http://www.idahopanhandleavalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of any Avalanche Center.
